name: Selective Mutism with Social Anxiety
chief_complaint: My child won't speak at school, but talks normally at home
symptoms: Consistent failure to speak in specific social situations
physical_findings: Normal speech and language development when comfortable
Avoidance of eye contact in triggering situations
Possible trembling or freezing when expected to speak
treatment: Possible SSRI medication in severe cases
prognosis: Good with early intervention, may persist into adolescence without treatment
description: A complex childhood anxiety disorder characterized by a child's inability to speak in select social settings despite having normal language skills. The mutism is not due to lack of knowledge or comfort with the spoken language, but rather extreme anxiety in specific situations.
risk_factors: Recent trauma or major life changes
